Case Description: Eartha Brute has stolen the Kremlin's Tsar Bell.
Intro Video Transcript:
Today's episode: Tsealing The Tsar Bell

Gumshoes, Carmen Sandiego and her confederacy of con artists has struck again. This time, they K.O.'d Moscow's ancient walled fortress the Kremlin. The belfry and bell tower of Ivan the Great are the tallest structures in the Kremlin. What's inside the belfry? Bells! Twenty one richly ornamented bells hang in the tower, and one more sits on a stone pedestal at the bottom. That's the big guy: the Tsar Bell. Cast in the 1730's, it weighs more than 200 tons, and is decorated with images of Russian royalty: a tsar and tsarina. It's the largest chimer in the world, and you'd think it would stay put. But no. When irresistible force meets immovable object, something's gotta give. What gave? The bell at the base. Eartha Brute broke in and stole the Tsar Bell. Gumshoes, your mission is to bring in Eartha, ring in the bell, and ding out Carmen Sandiego once and for all.

Presentation.Clue Description: The Chief has our first clue.
Video Transcripts: Eartha Brute has stolen the Tsar Bell, and there's no time to lose. Here's the profile on Eartha. A tall, troublesome tower whose belfry is bereft of brains. And here's what we know so far: Eartha took the bell to the homeland of another ancient monarchy, the kings of Siam. She dragged it into Aisawan Thipphaya-at, an island pavilion where the royals escape from the hot Bangkok summers. The pavilion, which appears to be floating on the lake, is one of the most photographed structures in the country. Now, on the grounds you'll also find a topiary garden where all the bushes have been trimmed into the shape of elephants. But be alert: it will be hard to pick Eartha out in this crowd.

Clues: Ancient monarchy of the kings of Siam

Presentation.Clue Description: We received a tip from ACME Pouchnet.
Video Transcripts:
Joey: G'day, mate. We saw your Eartha all right. Dragging a big bell behind.
Mother: It's big, all right. Her behind, that is. She's in a city not far from the Great Australian Bight. That's part of the continent that looks like somebody chomped a piece out of it.
Joey: She took a Popeye boat up the Torrens River to the zoo here, and head out.
Mother: She's got no manners, that one. Just grabbin' the food right out of the wallaby's mouth.
Joey: She's a bonzer babe, all right. [I have no idea what he said here.]

Clues: City near the Great Australian Bight

Video Transcripts:
Eartha: I have this ringing in my ears, Carmen. I can't figure it out.
Carmen: It's the bell, [???]. ACME can hear it, too. Disguise yourself as a bull, and head for the bullring at Campo Pequeno. It's in a port city on Europe's Atlantic coast.
Eartha: What if a matador comes after me with a sword?
Carmen: First of all, in this country they don't kill bulls at bullfights.
Eartha: Good. I can't stand blood, especially my own.
Carmen: And secondly, the matador isn't the main bullfighter. The real star is the Cavaleiro, who fights the bull on horseback.
Eartha: Me versus a guy on a horse? No problem, I'll clobber him!

Clues: Port city on Europe's Atlantic coast
Don't kill bulls at bullfights in this country

Round 1.Clue Description: Patty left Moldova and went back to the United States.

Clues.Clue: Eartha chugged her chime to the capital of South Carolina. Name it.
She jet-ski'd down the coast to Savannah. What state is she in?
She bulldozed her way due west across the border. What state is she in?
She hung her bell at the site of the Civil War's Battle Of Vicksburg. What state is she in?
She rafted over to Louisiana. What river did she cross?

Video Transcripts: Gumshoes, I spotted Eartha in one of the world's largest cities. She was fighting ten bulls at once in the world's largest bullfighting arena. And she was winning. Now listen, I know she hid the bell in a park right behind the monument called Los Niños Héroes. It honours young cadets who died defending their school during a US invasion in the 1840's. Trust me, that's where you'll find Eartha and the bell.

Clues: One of the world's largest cities
